intro: Psilogramme glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular psilogramme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in grasslands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. The species is noted for its aromatic foliage, which contains essential oils and has been used in traditional medicine.
